## CES-D vs SWAN

Harmony presents an innovative approach in comparing two widely recognized psychological instruments - CES-D (Center for Epidemiological Studies-Depression) and SWAN (Strengths and Weaknesses of ADHD Symptoms and Normal Behaviour Scale). Its cutting-edge functionality simplifies the harmonisation process by leveraging large generative AI models for a real-time comparison. Harmony is a user-friendly solution that not only facilitates item-to-item percentage match between CES-D and SWAN but also supports the comparison in multiple languages.


## Compare the items in CES-D English and SWAN

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import CES-D and SWAN into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just CES-D into Harmony</a> - compare CES-D English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just SWAN into Harmony</a> - compare SWAN with other instruments


## Using Harmony for CES-D vs SWAN

Given the cruciality of in-depth analysis in longitudinal studies, Harmony can greatly assist in saving time and ensuring accuracy in CES-D vs SWAN comparisons. Psychologists and researchers no longer need to suffer through tedious manual harmonisation in Excel or PDFs. Instead, they can conveniently drop their own instruments into Harmony's web interface. Additionally, Harmony's dynamic database hosts a wide range of instruments - including CES-D and SWAN - that can be easily selected for comparison.

## Harmony for Accurate and Efficient CES-D vs SWAN Analysis

Harmonising items within CES-D vs SWAN just became a lot easier and efficient with Harmony. This invaluable tool helps in identifying potential correlations and patterns between the survey items of the two instruments, providing a more holistic and nuanced understanding of study outcomes. Therefore, whether you're a social scientist or a psychologist, Harmony offers an unparalleled service in effectively harmonising and comparing CES-D vs SWAN, providing a major advantage in exploiting longitudinal studies to their full potential.
